description: A Republican senator crucial to Pete Hegseth’s chances of being confirmed as secretary of Defense said she would meet with him again next week and “that he deserves the opportunity to lay out his vision for our warfighters at a fair hearing.”
title: Ernst Says She’ll Confer With Hegseth After Trump Avers Support

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Taking Command of US Policy Before Taking Office

description: Chevron Corp.’s Israeli gas operations were targeted by Iran-backed Hezbollah in fighting before a US-backed cease-fire plan came into effect late last month, Chief Executive Officer Mike Wirth said.
title: Chevron Says Israel Gas Operations Were Targeted in Past Attacks

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s political operation received an influx of cash in the campaign’s final days from wealthy donors propping up a bid that had far less money on hand than Democratic rival Kamala Harris.
title: They Gave Millions to Trump. Now They’re Named to Top Jobs

description: Local authorities in Ukraine said at least 11 people died Friday in Russian strikes against two regions that also left dozens wounded.
title: Ukraine Says 11 Killed by Russian Air Attacks on Two Regions

description: The UK is set to join a security agreement signed by the US and Bahrain last year, a move that opens the possibility of incorporating other Middle East countries down the line.
title: UK Joins US-Bahrain Security Pact as Allies Deepen Gulf Ties

description: Iran abandoned its short-lived pledge to stop enriching uranium close to levels needed for nuclear weapons, the International Atomic Energy Agency said, ramping up tension with the West just weeks before Donald Trump begins his second term as US President.
title: Iran Scraps Vow to Curb Near Bomb-Grade Nuclear Fuel, IAEA Says

description: Here’s a look at the people Trump has named and what he expects of them.
title: Donald Trump’s Washington: Not Your Typical Presidential Cabinet

description: The European Union is pressing the US to explore ways to mitigate US sanctions on Russia’s Gazprombank, a financial institution key for keeping Russian natural gas flowing into the bloc.
title: EU in Talks With US to Mitigate Effect of Russian Bank Sanctions

description: France’s political drama reached an apex Dec. 4 when the lower house of parliament toppled the government for the first time in more than 60 years. President Emmanuel Macron is scrambling to find a new prime minister with enough support to avoid the same fate as Michel Barnier, the outgoing premier.
title: Can Macron Find a Path Out of France’s Political Impasse?

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for domestic production of weapons to be ramped up after his forces received the first batch of a new drone-missile.
title: Zelenskiy Urges Boost to Arms Output as Military Gets New Weapon

description: TikTok’s Chinese parent company faces a ban in the US if it doesn’t meet a Jan. 19 deadline to sell the video-sharing app as a result of a federal appeals court ruling Friday.
title: TikTok Faces US Ban After Appeals Court Refuses to Block Law

description: Donald Trump’s planned tax cuts would wipe out Canada’s slim corporate tax advantage, likely driving more capital from the northern nation and deepening its productivity crisis.
title: Canada Under Pressure to Respond to Trump’s Tax Cut Regime

description: South Korea’s brush with martial law is a reminder that democracy is not self-sustaining.
title: The End of Passive Democracy

description: Canada will establish two new Arctic consulates in Alaska and Greenland and appoint a dedicated Arctic ambassador as part of a long-awaited strategy for a region where Russia and China are increasingly seeking to assert their influence.
title: Canada Seeks Stronger US Ties in Arctic to Counter Russia, China

description: President-elect Donald Trump offered support for Pete Hegseth, his embattled pick for Defense secretary, amid allegations of personal and financial misconduct that threaten the nominee’s prospects for confirmation.
title: Trump Offers Public Support for Embattled Defense Pick Hegseth

description: Romania’s Constitutional Court unexpectedly ordered the country to rerun the first round of the presidential race and canceled the second round runoff set for this Sunday, the first such move in the country’s history.
title: Romania Top Court Orders Rerun of Presidential Vote

description: The European Union and the South American Mercosur bloc clinched a long-sought trade deal over the vehement objections of France, which has pledged to lead a charge to obstruct its ratification.
title: EU Reaches Long-Sought Mercosur Deal Over French Objections

description: South Korea’s K-pop loving Gen Z has largely stayed away from the street protests that has erupted since the country was rocked by the biggest political crisis in four decades this week.
title: K-Pop Loving South Korea Youth Watch Protest Rallies From Afar

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said his government would have to consider raising taxes in the event of an economic shock, in a retreat from Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’s promise to business last month that she wouldn’t ask them to pay more this Parliament.
title: Starmer Says Shocks Could Spur Tax Rises, Softening Reeves Line

description: President Javier Milei aspires to reform Argentina’s economy in the way Ireland turned around its fortunes over the past three decades. The Irish see more nuance to their own story.
title: Milei Admires Ireland for an Economic Statistic the Irish Don’t Favor

description: Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad is increasingly desperate for Russian and Iranian help as rebel forces close in on the strategically important city of Homs, hoping his strongest allies will come to his rescue just as they did when he was on the brink of losing power in 2015.
title: Syrian Rebels Eye Next Prize While Assad Awaits Russia and Iran

description: Bulgarian lawmakers ended a month-long deadlock over the appointment of a parliamentary speaker as the effort to form a government after a snap vote in October grinds on.
title: Bulgaria Breaks Speaker Deadlock in Bid to Start Cabinet Talks

description: NBA teams will return to play in the Chinese market for the first time since 2019, when a social media post during pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong caused backlash from local fans and broadcasters.
title: NBA Returns to China for Pre-Season Games After Protest Row

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Race Is On to Shape Trump’s Ukraine Deal

description: German Finance Minister Joerg Kukies played down concerns in financial markets about French political turbulence, saying investors appeared to be reacting in a “constructive” and “orderly” manner to the removal of the government.
title: German Finance Chief Plays Down Concerns Around French Turmoil

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz gained further ground on conservative opposition leader Friedrich Merz in a new opinion poll, drawing close to his main challenger ahead of February’s snap election.
title: Scholz Gains Ground on Conservative Challenger Merz in New Poll

description: There has been no decision by the so-called BRICS block about creating a common currency to reduce usage of the dollar, India’s central bank chief said.
title: India Downplays BRICS Common Currency Plan That Angered Trump

description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he will veto the European Union’s next long-term budget unless Hungary regains access to the bloc’s funds that were frozen due to rule-of-law and corruption concerns.
title: Orban Threatens EU Budget Veto Unless Hungary Funds Are Released

description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, what prompted South Korea’s president to declare martial law, how the chaos unfolded and what it means for the country’s future
title: Behind the Six Hours of Martial Law That Stunned South Korea

description: The head of South Korea’s Army Special Forces said he defied an order from President Yoon Suk Yeol’s former defense chief to drag lawmakers out of National Assembly’s main building to enforce a martial law decree earlier this week.
title: Special Forces Chief in Seoul Defied Order to Drag Out Lawmakers

description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra ruled out any immediate move to increase the value-added tax after a proposal by the finance minister to more than double the levy drew criticism from the opposition and a key member of the ruling coalition.
title: Thailand Rules Out Raising Value-Added Tax After Public Outcry

description: Beijing has set out to extend its domestic laws across international borders with a ban on selling some goods to the US that applies to companies both inside and outside China.
title: China Sets Precedent by Banning Others From Selling Goods to US

description: MANAMA, Bahrain (AP) — Iran said Friday it conducted a successful space launch, the latest for its program the West alleges improves Tehran’s ballistic missile program.
title: Iran Says it Conducted a Successful Space Launch in Program Long Criticized by West

description: Sorting the hard-working wheat from the tax-dodging chaff may not be so straightforward for the Labour government.
title: Messing With Farmers Is a Dangerous Game

description: Reed Recruitment says budget is hitting firms and consumers, adding gloom over Britain’s near-term prospects.
title: Christmas Job Ads at Recession Levels in Warning for UK Economy

description: Ghana’s government has overseen a restructuring of most public debt, secured a $3 billion International Monetary Fund bailout and rebooted the West African nation’s economy. That probably won’t be enough to spare the ruling party and its presidential candidate from defeat in Saturday’s election.
title: Ghana Ruling Party Risks Election Loss in Debt-Crisis Aftermath

description: On the first day of Russia’s full-scale invasion, Roman Solomonyuk shocked his family when he volunteered to fight. But over two-and-a-half years later, he’s joined the growing number of Ukrainian soldiers who’ve called it quits.
title: In Ukraine, More and More Exhausted Soldiers Abandon Their Posts

description: Ireland’s parliament is the worst for gender diversity in western Europe, even after boosting its quota rules for its recent general election, a setback for a country that has become the poster child for achieving rapid social progress in recent decades.
title: Irish Parliament Has Lowest Gender Diversity in Western Europe

description: Elon Musk poured at least $274 million into political groups in 2024, fueling a spending spree that helped Donald Trump win the presidency, and securing a new title for himself: the most prolific donor of the election cycle.
title: The World’s Richest Man Is Now America’s Biggest Political Donor

description: The first time President Xi Jinping ousted several top generals, he was removing a rival power base in the Communist Party. Now he’s even getting rid of one of his own loyalists, suggesting fresh problems with the military.
title: Xi’s New Military Purge Is Broadest Since He Ousted Rival Clique

description: US, Japan and the Philippines on Friday held a new round of maritime cooperative activity within Manila’s exclusive economic zone following a flare-up of tensions in the disputed South China Sea.
title: US, Japan, Philippines Hold Fresh Sea Drills Amid China Tensions

description: US President-elect Donald Trump said he is nominating former Senator David Perdue as the US ambassador to China, enlisting a business executive-turned politician for one of his most important diplomatic posts.
title: Trump Taps Ex-Senator David Perdue for Ambassador to China

description: Japanese Foreign Minister Takeshi Iwaya said Tokyo intends to pick up trade talks with President-elect Donald Trump with an understanding that the elimination of tariffs on cars and auto parts will be on the agenda.
title: Japan Eyes Talks With Trump That Include Cutting Auto Tariffs

description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida expressed concern about political upheaval in South Korea undermining progress in bilateral relations.
title: Former Japan PM Kishida Worried Upheaval in Seoul May Hurt Ties

description: Mexico’s leader surprised Donald Trump in a phone call by speaking in fluent English, an ability he’s rarely encountered with Latin American leaders.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Shows Off English to Build Rapport with Trump

description: Donald Trump says he is selecting venture capitalist David Sacks of Craft Ventures LLC to serve as his artificial intelligence and crypto czar, a newly created position that underscores the president-elect’s intent to boost two rapidly developing industries.
title: Trump Names David Sacks as White House AI and Crypto Czar

description: The leader of South Korea’s ruling party said President Yoon Suk Yeol should be suspended from office quickly, an abrupt shift in stance that makes it more likely an impeachment motion will pass.
title: Key Ally of South Korea’s Leader Now Wants Him Gone in Shift

description: A top Ukrainian official met with Vice President-elect JD Vance and members of President-elect Donald Trump’s national security team Thursday as Ukraine prepares for a major shift in US policy on its war with Russia, about to enter its fourth year.
title: Vance, Trump National Security Aides Meet Top Ukraine Official

description: Peruvian authorities are investigating whether unpopular President Dina Boluarte temporarily abandoned her role as head of state to have secret nose surgery.
title: Peru Prosecutors Probe President Boluarte on Secret Nose Surgery

description: UK household incomes will be held back by budget tax increases in a blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s new goal of “raising living standards in every part of the UK,” according to the Confederation for British Industry.
title: Starmer Living Standards Goal Hampered By UK Tax Rises, CBI Says
